intro: Linnaea borealis f. subamoenula, commonly known as the lesser twinflower, is a rare and distinctive plant belonging to the family Ericaceae. It is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, which bloom in early spring. The plant is native to boreal and subarctic regions of North America and Eurasia, often growing in moist, acidic soils. Its foliage consists of opposite, ovate leaves that are glossy and dark green. This variant is distinguished by its smaller flowers and more compact growth habit compared to the typical form of Linnaea borealis.
